Job Title: Medical Editor

Location: Yardley, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Red Nucleus is hiring a Medical Editor to join our global team! This is a hybrid role based out of our Yardley, PA office.

Our purpose is advancing knowledge to improve lives. We succeed by being the premier provider of strategic learning and development, scientific advisory services, and medical communications solutions for the life sciences industry. Our global team is composed of nearly 800 full-time employees whose commitment to creativity, quality, and on-time delivery is unrivaled in our space.

At Red Nucleus, we believe in providing a rich working environment that pushes us to innovate in ways that engages our employees to be their best selves. Our culture is about meaningful work, a true sense of community, and fun. We love to celebrate our people and we are proud to have been Internationally recognized as a “Great Place to Work".

How You Will Contribute

In this position, you will be working with our Learning & Development team. For more information about our team, please visit L&D I Red Nucleus.

As a Medical Editor, you collaborate with a group of individuals with diverse skills to accomplish a common goal: to create materials and programs that meet—or even exceed—Red Nucleus standards and client expectations.

You work closely with your Client Service Director (CSD), who has direct management responsibility for the larger team, as well as your team Senior Project Managers (SPMs)/Project Managers (PMs). You collaborate with the Medical Directors (MDs), Senior Medical Writers (SMWs)/Medical Writers (MWs), Instructional Designers (IDs), Artists, Developers, and Associate Project Managers (APMs) to edit and quality assure deliverables in a timely manner. You also work closely with the Sales/Marketing team to edit proposals, pitch decks, and marketing materials/resources. Finally, you work interdepartmentally to assist with overflow editorial needs from other teams or offices.

Responsibilities Include

Proofreading and editing medical/scientific-related scripts, storyboards, print layouts, and multimedia presentations to ensure their correctness, clarity, and qualityAssuring correctness and functionality of deliverables (e.g., e-learning modules, simulations, e-blasts, mobile applications) by being detailed oriented in editing, content review, and quality assuranceReference checking and compilation


About You

BA/BS in English or related subject; or equivalent experienceMinimum 2 years’ experience as an editor/quality coordinator (agency setting is a plus but not required)Experience ensuring the quality of multimedia programsExperience using databases a plusKnowledge and experience in the life sciences industry a plusPharmaceutical, medical device, and/or biotechnology sales training experience a plusExceptional writing, communication, and organizational skillsAbility to handle multiple tasks, and to prioritize those tasksAbility to handle multiple and changing deadlines


What You Will Enjoy at Red Nucleus

 Competitive pay, incentives, retirement, and income security programs Comprehensive benefits and wellness programs focused on healthy lifestyles Generous paid time off, employee assistance programs, and flexible work arrangements Performance-driven environment, including professional development and transfer opportunities People-first culture fostering self-expression, diversity, and a growth mindset Celebrations! We love to celebrate service anniversaries, holidays, diversity and inclusion events, project milestones, and anything else that is meaningful to our employees Support of the community organizations you are passionate about Ongoing programs and events designed to bring our global team together


Diversity, equity and inclusion are valued at Red Nucleus and we believe we have a shared responsibility to provide equal opportunity and foster an inclusive spirit. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, caste, sexual orientation, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

To learn more about working at Red Nucleus, please visit Careers I Red Nucleus.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
